feed.title: Posting Hole
feed.subtitle: pokecapn's posting hole for blogospherers custom

entry.title: empty kpop sets make for insane liminal spaces
entry.content:
so every morning I head over to r/liminalspace and pick my new Zoom background for the day. this serves as a nice mini-ritual to start work and makes meetings ever so slightly more fun. I've been doing this, although not always with that subreddit, for something like 5 and a half years at this point. that is a lot of "liminal spaces" i've exposed myself to.

there is much argument over what is and isn't a liminal space, but since I just find it really funny that people experience spiritual levels of emotion to a picture of an empty hotel lobby with the elevator open, I'm don't really sweat the details. I think as long as you get the sense that you're alone, and either moving from point A to point B or taking a pit stop somewhere uselessly detached from society, that's a liminal space.

all of which leads me to a brilliant brainstorm I had in the middle of the night in 2021, when I was re-watching Pristin V's Get It (as you do) and there was this second-long shot of an empty room with a nonsense hexagonal couch, fluorescent lighting, and a bunch of mirrors going nowhere. that's when I realized that in the quest for hyper-stimulating visuals, kpop music videos end up churning out insane liminal spaces as set pieces. normally you don't pick up on it because someone is almost always there on the set, interrupting the liminality, but I cracked the code.

so I made a tweet with that shot, another shot from the same MV, and a couple more I had remembered or thought I remembered from other MVs. I had a followup ready to go in the afternoon to get more eyeballs on it because I thought it was really good. and then, I kept going. it was now just the secondary game I play of "find the liminal spaces" whenever I watch music videos or their behinds. appending to the thread every two weeks or so, I've now hit about 300 kpop liminal spaces.

I've decided to keep the threads going on Twitter and Bluesky, but I also collected the whole thing in this imgur gallery that hopefully I'll remember to keep updated. these images are pokecapn-approved for your own Zoom backgrounds, or for any time you need to zone out and drift between realities:

kpop liminal spaces

entry.title: pokecapn's top 30+ kpop of 2022
entry.content:
(the rules)

  1. i listened to over 1500 songs, to bring you
  2. 30 that Kick Ass per my exacting standards for this list, "awards" for 10 more songs that weren't making the cut, and another 125 i found good or at least entertaining in a bonus playlist
  3. no year end lists tinted these judgments. all opinions are my own. probably
  4. original air date: November 29, 2023

previous years: 2017 | 2018 | 2019 | 2020 | 2021

awards

The Best Cover(?) Award: Funtwo, Jane, AZ - aespa - Next Level (Guitar Cover)

The Literally Just "Take On Me" Award: Pentagon - Sparkling Night

The Pryda Snare Award - Coin Star: Psy - Everyday

The Pryda Snare Award - Minigame Star: Seulgi - Los Angeles

The Pryda Snare Award - Happening Star: Lapillus - Queendom

The "We Have A Taemin Track At Home" Award: KOM - Adrenaline

The "No Really, The Song Is Good Too, Honest!" Award: (tie) Kara - When I Move, Apink Bomi & Hayoung - Red Carpet

The This Sucks But I Keep Thinking About It Award: Ryeohwa feat. Mistakim - Cowboy

The Most Likely To Have Been Rejected From A Mission: Impossible Soundtrack Award: Itzy - Voltage

the list

30) NewJeans - Hype Boy

no one singing this song has installed Windows XP before, but that didn't stop them from cranking all the numbers up and trying anyway

29) Chungha - Sparkling

a smooth and refreshing twist on the 160ish bpm synthpop formula that we've seen for the past couple of years. literally refreshing! cans open! in the song!

28) Pixy - Villain

very cool and nasty. am i the only one blacking out and seeing rapid-fire pictures of cats during the choruses? just me? i should get that looked at.

27) Red Velvet - Snap Snap

i think it's aiming for a naughty 2.0, a great house thumper that SM has regularly been able to give its artists

26) Billlie - GingaMingaYo (the strange world)

by all means i should just bounce right off the singsongy nursery rhyme chorus, but the fatness of the track and chewiness of the synths keeps me coming back

25) Oh My Girl - Replay

vicious destruction coming out of nowhere. 2 and a half very short minutes of dank filth

24) Wonho - Eye On You

a no bullshit track that cruises along, with great pauses to build up and release tension, and delightful synths that crank up during the chorus. energizer

23) STAYC - Poppy

i could have held this until the 2023 list since it did get a korean version but i though-POPPY POPPY POPOPPY POPPY POPPY LOVE LOVE POPPY POPPY POPOPPY POPPY POPPY LOVE LOVE POPPY POPPY POPOPPY POPPY POPPY LOVE LOVE POPPY POPPY POPOPPY PO

22) Drippin - The One

this year's production team that shows up multiple times in the list is the tag team of TAK & Corbin at NEWTYPE, starting with this fantastic drum & bass pop-rock hybrid. a great way to start your day

21) Purple Kiss - Pretty Psycho

the philosophy for purple kiss house tracks seems to be to load up a solid foundation with random shit and it works great. beethoven, classic movie samples, and speed garage wobble, together at last

20) Nature - Limbo

if more songs could detour into 10 seconds of psytrance for no reason that'd be swell, thanks

19) woo!ah! - Rollercoaster

it's finally time to slow down and enjoy a synthwave dreamscape. CRJ energy will be channeled several times on this trip up the list

18) fromis_9 - Rewind

while we mourn the death of any wild ass concepts ever gracing fromis_9 again, we can still appreciate solid heavily replayable b sides like this

17) Limelight - Starlight

slots right into the izone gap you didn't know you had. that one meme but the guy's going "it my fiesta fr!!!!"

16) Key - Bound

yo man what you got there, sega genesis???? the fm synth bass is off the charts

15) Yena - Pretty Boys

picture-perfect 80's throwback. way too good to be trapped on an EP with no promotion

14) Nayeon - Pop!

fast-paced bass, brass, and heys. hold on a second. now just what exactly are we popping here.

13) ATEEZ - Halazia

this one's a real ride between insanely high and deep vocals, going off the rails into drum and bass and hardstyle at the end. waiting for the day that "off the rails" becomes "the rails". that'll be something

12) Le Sserafim - Blue Flame

it's simple, it's catchy, and the star of the show is the megabass 2000 watt rms in the prechorus

11) Viviz - Bop Bop!

ezaels ocsid nimmals

10) Limelight - Eye To Eye

strap in for another dreamscape. the vocals have more room to work than the other limelight track and you can just lie down and let the waves roll in

9) Ive - Love Dive

doomsday plodding processed out the goat ass. this is a compliment. i'm convinced they're going for an another brick in the wall vibe

8) Kep1er - MVSK

a relentless assault where the only constant is change. many angry basses, unintelligible synth brass, anti-drops becoming real drops, and a trip into triplet time just for fun

7) Kwon Eunbi - Croquis

pounding productivity-enhancing house. i can and have put this on repeat for an hour. 2:17 is a great advancement in "vocals as instrument"

6) Rocket Punch - Louder

this song fucks. no further explanation needed, just listen to it

5) Taeyeon - INVU

effortless emotional dreamworld. mirror-polished. you get the feeling no one was allowed to mess this one up

4) CSR - Pop? Pop!

pure sugar fresh air with a truckload of cool rhythms and sounds. the part before the third chorus is like a boast from the production team: "we could have made this absolute dogshit, but we are masters of the craft in full control"

3) WJSN Chocome - Super Yuppers!

the song: the 80s are here, again. me:

2) Cherry Bullet - Love In Space

what's 156 bpm, is dominated by offbeat bass stabs, and features 16th note melodies? that's right, they've finally discovered the secret formula to poppify eurobeat

1) Kwon Eunbi - Glitch

a journey into sound. discover silken vocals weaving through garage with massive build ups into chunky four on the floor, replete with the titular glitching. then get blasted by the finish. lost in chimes, you conclude: "damn"

Thank You For Playing

BONUS PLAYLIST

here is a playlist with a total of 165 songs from 2022. why 165? because i got tired of cutting songs from the list

entry.title: pokecapn's top 30+ kpop of 2021
entry.content:
(the rules)

  1. all tracks are fair game, i listened to.. a lot
  2. i like my kpop like my GoldenEye 64—Slappers Only
  3. "unbiased". i somehow avoided seeing any year end lists
  4. there's a bonus at the end!
  5. actually it's Remote Mines

previous years: 2017 | 2018 | 2019 | 2020

2023 edit: I have tried to preserve as much of the original tweet thread as possible. Dead links have been fixed, formatting tweaked to work with cohost the blogosphere, but otherwise the order and descriptions are straight from July 23 2022, whatever that entails.

awards

The This Should Have Been In 2020's List And Probably Like Number One Or Two Award: IZ*ONE - Daydream

The Pryda Snare Award: Skyle - Fly Up High

The Literally Just "Take On Me" Award: Rocket Punch - Ring Ring

Best Intro Track Award: Chungha - Side C (Unknown)

Most Improved By Replacing The Entire Song Award: Shinee - Don't Call Me (Fox Stevenson Remix)

The "I don't get it, is that good" Award: (tie) Billlie - Ring x Ring, Purple Kiss - Ponzona

the list

30) PinkFantasy - Poison

Dreamcatcher's Piri gets more of a J-feel to it and picks up a guitar solo and some cool eurotrance synths in the chorus

29) Bébe Yana - Strawberry Kisses

it's pronounced "garridge"

28) Everglow - Pirate

we got us a map, to lead us to a big room track, that's choreoed for tiktok, and buried deep away. we'll dig up the track, we know it's full of precious brass stabs. tik open the toks, and then we'll say "now let me introduce myself

27) Red Velvet - Pose

i don't even remember what the title track on this album was, because it so obviously should have been Pose. the synths in the verses unnerve you just enough to release all that tension during the chorus

26) Do Han Se - Take Over

sure, it's filthy, but absolutely nothing will prepare you for what happens at 2:44 in the video no matter how many times you watch it

25) Hot Issue - Gratata

this song tries so hard it triggers quality underflow and wraps around to kicking ass. it's got like 40 or 50 heys. sometimes i wonder if all famous snipers know how to bang-ah bang-ah bang-ah. please let me have this

24) Everglow - Nighty Night

one day, hoovers will grace kpop more frequently than once every 2 or 3 years, and i will finally be able to have this list write itself

23) aespa - Next Level

SM has a history of buying existing tracks and making them more memorable than the originals. i kinda hope aespa's concept never changes and the heartfelt ballad sections of their concerts are total fucking nonsense about nft snakes

22) SHINee - Atlantis

it's by-the-numbers kpop, but the chorus synth goes hard as shit

21) Dreamcatcher - Whistle

gonna tell my kids this was blackpink's lovesick girls

20) N.O.M - Mega Punch

there is nothing wrong with helping a buddy out

19) Lightsum - You, jam

smashing like 3 decades together and hoping it all works out. when more songs "sample" cybotron, i will finally be able to have this list write itself. there is some monster sub-bass that kicks in from 2:25-2:35

18) Brave Girls feat. E-Chan - Pool Party

one cool thing about 2021's kpop output is that i could have kept this whole list firmly planted in the 80s and it wouldn't even have been wrong

17) Ha:tfelt feat. Keem Hyoeun - Summertime

heavy ethereal plodding

16) AKMU with IU - Nakka

heavier ethereal plodding. death disco

15) Tomorrow X Together - No Rules

a great feature of the microblog is that i can say this song's the freaky lovechild of uptown funk and boom boom dollar and my followers will reply with "what's uptown funk?" not much man what's uptown funk with you

14) Yukika - Secret

that little tinkly synth lets you know exactly what you're getting into. it turns out the composer for this track, dr. jo, also wrote my 2017 no.1, gugudan's a girl like me. i'm sure this won't come up later

13) Mondo Grosso feat. BoA - Everything Needs Love (Re-New JP)

before you complain about how this doesn't count or whatever, did you hear that ｂａｓｓｌｉｎｅ？？？？

12) Cherry Bullet - Keep Your Head Up

i described this song as "buck wild" when i first heard it and i stand by that. putting a bangin donk on a car crash with the orinoco flow

11) Chancellor feat. Gaeko - Midnight

looks at notes this just says "out-chromeo" and there's a circle around it

10) Mirae - Killa

it's all killa no filla lol lmao! but seriously this track tears shit up

9) Purple Kiss - Zombie

kpop proves once again that you can just repeat the same syllable over and over as a hook, and somehow it works flawlessly

8) Yuqi - Bonnie & Clyde

is it kpop if a chinese woman is singing in english over a track made by a bunch of swedes? yes, absolutely, and it whips

7) Oh My Girl - Dun Dun Dance

Check out Oh My Girl's new single "Dun Dun Dance" if you get the chance. Sound of the summer.

6) IU - Lilac

it came up later, here's another song written by dr. jo, and just that much better. let the synths wash over you and enjoy the ride

5) Lightsum - Vanilla

if you were waiting for the slow burner that drills directly into your brain, this is it. i can't even walk down the ice cream aisle without thinking "oh my gossshhh"

4) Dreamcatcher - Because

when more songs are best described as "yandere drum and bass", this list will finally be able to write itself

3) Enhypen - Drunk-Dazed

the last time song titles described what they sounded like this accurately, they were called shit like "afternoon waltz in g minor". relentlessly pounding pounding techno music that sounds exactly like 5 am

2) Rocket Punch - Ride

synthwave polished to a mirror finish. love the crashes during the final chorus. this kept me alive through 2021. the only way you could improve this is slow it down 50 bpm, add some nu disco and italo elements, and crank up the melancholy

1) Key - Bad Love

oh hey would you look at that!! key singing like he's kinda yelling or shouting every lyric actually totally sells the vibe of the track, which brings retro synths, supercharged vocals, and modern production into a delicious mix

Thank You For Playing

BONUS PLAYLIST:

including these, here are 100 kpops from 2021 that either i enjoyed, had interesting ideas, or were otherwise totally ridiculous and worth a listen

entry.title: pokecapn's top 30ish kpop of 2020
entry.content:
(the rules)

  1. anything goes. i listened to... maybe 1500 tracks to bring you these fine goods. over 460 "above the mendoza line"
  2. the song must Kick Ass per my exacting standards
  3. but first, some awards for songs that didn't make it!

previous years: 2017 | 2018 | 2019

2023 edit: I have tried to preserve as much of the original tweet thread as possible. Dead links have been fixed, images uploaded, formatting tweaked to work with cohost the blogosphere, but otherwise the order and descriptions are straight from December 31 2020, whatever that entails.

awards

The Most Mindblowing Chorus In A Song No One Will Remember Award: Berry Good - Accio

The Pryda Snare Award: ANS - Say My Name

The Literally Just "Take On Me" Award: Boyhood - Retro Love

The Every Single Song From This Group Misses The Mark, But In Really Interesting Ways, Also Whenever I See Their Name I Think About DJ Mehdi's Signatune Award: Cignature. let's go with Arisong for illustration purposes

The "No Really, The Song Is Good Too, Honest!" Award: Apink YOS - Love Is Blind

The You Can't Put A 15 Minute Long Mashup With Five Movements On The List Award: Red Velvet - 78 Tracks Full Mashup "Red Velvet Cake 2019"

The Most Likely To Be In This List If You Asked Me Again A Few Months From Now Award: (tie) LOONA - Voice, Verivery - Lay Back, IZ*ONE - Sequence

and now, the actual list!

the list

30) EXID - B.L.E.S.S.E.D

sometimes all you really need is drum and bass played completely straight

29) XUM - DDALALA

Shinsadong Tiger wakes up from over a year of hibernation and applies the formula: find a 2 year old song and take it Up to a new Level. cue the lawsuit in Five, Four, Three Two One

28) Yooa - Diver

the funk is strong with this one. the verses are... mostly just there, but this really shines in the chorus as the vocal syncopation plays off the instruments and the beat

27) Elris - This Is Me

maybe I'm just really weak to drumstep interludes, but I think this track fires on all cylinders. just the right fuel mixture of fartbass, uplifting synths, and canned samples

26) WJSN - Hola

This has the same composer/producer team as all of Cignature's songs, but somehow it's this B side where they manage to pull the reins in and completely nail the high pitched manic energy they've overshot 3-4 times with Cignature

25.5) I said Cignature too many times and now we have to watch Signatune.

25) Twice - Cry For Me

in typical JYP fashion we have a song that feels instantly familiar and fresh at the same time. the verses gradually build through a genre-blender before giving way to pounding beats and breaks, overlaid with euro-style melancholy

24) BVNDIT - Jungle

this track rides and dies on that nasty ass synth in the chorus. the fact that the beat can't make up its mind is somehow a plus

23) ONF - Sukhumvit Swimming

i believe this is best described as "coughing up into a super soaker and shooting it in people's mouths"

22) Lovelyz - Dream in a Dream

this has stuck with me because it's so out there. 140 BPM four on the floor with some freak ass cyber dollhouse thing going on. the high note run at the end is at the edge of mortal comprehension

21) Everglow - La Di Da

of all the Dua Lipa - Physical ripoffs that came out this fall, this one is bestest. it also actually fits in with Everglow's signature sound of "ridiculous brass stabs every goddamn measure" and "Yiren whispers at some point"

20) WJSN Chocome - Hmph!

it's so nice to see Orange Caramel are putting out songs again. wait, what do you mean i've got the script wrong?

19) Ryu Sujeong - Tiger Eyes

probably one of the last kind of sounds on your mind when you hear "lovelyz solo". relentless house with the female equivalent of the "horny on main" vibe that's in Taemin's lead singles. speaking of which,

18) Taemin - Criminal

definitely sends the message of "don't mess with the maestro" when it comes to riding the filth snake

17) Weeekly - Tag Me

you open a bag of "sugar in the raw" and this song falls out

16) Sunmi - pporappippam

feels almost like a "Heroine 2.0", trying to sand off what didn't work while sticking to a fusion of italo and bombastic brass

15) Cherry Bullet - Hands Up

this song is so dumb and uninspired it wraps all the way around into brilliance. all it's missing is the heys and gos

465) Cherry Bullet - Hands Up, but with the Heys and Gos

alright nevermind

14) fromis_9 - Feel Good (Secret Code)

Check out fromis_9's new single "Feel Good (Secret Code)" if you get the chance. Sound of the summer.

13) Red Velvet Irene & Seulgi - Naughty

insanely competent house, like, you could probably release it to the clubs without the vocals and it'd do just fine

12) Elris - No Big Deal

if you close your eyes, you can see the neon gridlines on this retro synth soundscape, at least until some weird ass sound effects take you out of it

11) Rocket Punch - Bouncy

scene: some music studio. the composers are fucking around with synths, and land on this song's lead. one turns to the other and says "wow, that synth sounds bouncy." and the world was never the same

10) STAYC - So Bad

this has gone from like 28 to 10 over the past month and there's a good chance it'd keep climbing if there was another month to go. impossibly pop-glossy drum and bass with a chorus that drills right into your hippocampus

9) Golden Child - One (Lucid Dream)

fart bass? funk? Daft Punk? it's yours, my friend, as long as you have enough attention span

8) April - Oops I'm Sorry

i swear this clown car trap reggae mess is just an incredibly clever re-interpretation of Take On Me, and this type of freakshow ingenuity is what you can't get anywhere outside of kpop

7) (G)I-dle - Maybe

total bass envelopment. the combination of epic and plodding gives off the aura of "closing out the set at 3am" as you stumble around, figuring out how much of a friend any nearby walls are

6) GFriend - Mago

evokes about 5 different italo/hi-nrg/eurobeat songs without really directly pointing at any of them. i went searching for about 2 hours. the closest i could find was D-Essex - Victim Of Love for the pre-chorus

5) JYP duet with Sunmi - When We Disco

aside from some filter and pad effects, JYP channels italo without a hint of irony and fuckin kills it. turns out ""half air half sound"" is a dead ringer for italo vocals. and who doesn't like a good key change?

4) Itzy - Wannabe

The Speed Garage Trap Hell Massive returns with a vengeance. this whole year i've been cursed with either Yeji's part at 1:38 or the dance break instrumental barging in whenever my train of thought goes silent for a few seconds

3) WJSN - Pantomime

this song is so fucked up buck wild i have no idea where to begin or end. i don't even want to spoil it for you by mentioning why it's so good. imagine getting on splash mountain with no idea you drop. i want you to experience that

2) Dreamcatcher - Scream

while we're on a disney kick, this is the shit Blackbeard uses to boost his pirate zombie army's morale. monstrously thick guitars and brass, but the real star of the show is the polyrhythm in the chorus

1) Yukika - Shade

it's so rare that a kpop album sticks to the same concept through its tracks, never mind actually tells a story. Shade is a break-up song that's the last "real" track of an album where every previous track has been cheery and upbeat. the song itself is an expert global fusion: a little bit new-wave, italo, and city pop. it hits you in the feels so hard that after it is the outro, a 90 second lo-fi track (that still fits in the story!), seemingly there for you to recover yourself in time for the bonus tracks

Thank You For Playing (PS the whole album is good)

entry.title: pokecapn's top 20 kpop of 2019
entry.content:
(the rules)

  1. only singles with music videos. pokecapns can have little an exception, as a treat.
  2. the song must Kick Ass per my exacting standards
  3. i put this off until 2 hours ago so i probably forgot stuff and the order's all wrong
  4. hours of sleep

previous years: 2017 | 2018

2023 edit: I have tried to preserve as much of the original tweet thread as possible. Dead links have been fixed, images uploaded(?), formatting tweaked to work with cohost the blogosphere, but otherwise the order and descriptions are straight from December 31 2019, whatever that entails.

??) ICU - Cupid

i can't in good conscience call this number 20. it's like someone fed rejected eurodance filler into a cat until it went urp all over the carpet. it's so jank they pronounce their team name wrong. i love it.

20) Nature - Oopsie (My Bad)

i was really enjoying how dank this song was until someone in the youtube comments said loha's part 1:31 sounds like "my gun is up your bussy" and now i blame the kids for everything wrong in this world

19) Eyedi - & New

you could argue it's not possible to be "too aesthetic" but i'm going to have to draw the line at deliberately adding wow and flutter. if you can get past that, solid 80s feel

18) Dreamcatcher - Deja Vu

this song is 30 seconds long with a 3 minute long intro. but it's a really good intro. the choir chanting bits put it over the edge

17) BewhY - Gottasadae

anyone can throw the first half of Yeezus into a blender, but it takes craft to pour out an actual song from the resulting slurry

16) Yoyomi - Surely

it's so nice to see Orange Caramel are putting out songs again. wait, what do you mean i've got the script wrong?

15) Oneus - Valkyrie

the guitar riff is here to reassure you and guide you throughout the song. worth pointing out is the housey second verse and the synth and guitar blending together during the choruses

14) Everglow - Adios

Everglow's sole reason for existence seems to be to try and out-Blackpink Blackpink. they certainly did

13) Weki Meki - Picky Picky

check the credits for this song. it took at least 10 people to make a brave brothers sound-alike. but you can't argue with the results; a fucked up bouncy drum and bass track that dj snake takes a shit on during the chorus. it's even got the heys

12) AOA - Come See Me

against the odds(?) everything comes together into a catchy little pile with a bit of yee haw added for good measure. this has got even more heys.

11) Hong Jinyoung - Love Tonight

this is just italo in disguise

10) Hinapia - Drip

scientists have described the sub-bass in this song as "off the charts". a flower explodes and a skull gets drowned in goo. i guess the synths are firmly in 2008 but that's fine by me

09) Taemin - Want

pure filth. an actual mountain of crud and sludge. disgusting

08) Itzy - Dalla Dalla

The JYP massive descends into Speed Garage Trap Hell and it is glorious

07) CLC - Me

are songs still allowed to slap? is that okay? everyone here cool with a little slappening? great. this song slaps. stank nasty brass and hangry rolling bass kicks

06) Rocket Punch - Bim Bam Bum

i, no shit, fired up stepmania in august to try and make a stepfile of this, before i remembered that i hadn't done this for 13 years and it was going to be a colossal pain in the ass because i wanted to fill it with every speed and freeze gimmick under the sun

05) Saturday - Bbyong

this is actually a shameless retread of Psy's New Face, but precision engineered to drill a hole in your brain. thanks

04) Apink - %%

the large genre collider fires again and creates crazed ethereal trance disco breaks

03) CLC - No.1 (the whole EP)

"you can't put a whole album in a slot" i am much better than other household pets when it comes to the heavy ass kicking content of this EP

02) DIA - Woowa

i am elementally weak to rave synths and hoovers and the little housey sax thingy noodling away in the right channel during the chorus. this song doesn't stop. i tried to make a stepfile out of this one too

01) fromis_9 - Love Rumpumpum

step 1, find something in the SAW back catalog and update the instruments, but not too much. step 2, say the same thing over and over again in the chorus. step 3, you're already done, you've mined purestrain k-pop

Thank You For Playing
